label: Description
value: Mask of grinning demon, horned; the mouth is open and pierced through. The pupils are black.

label: Description
value: Bag of colored silks, crocheted in horizontal bands ornamented with geometric forms and floral sprays; drawstring closure and ornamented with tassels and balls.

label: Description
value: Oval box with hinged cover; niello decoration, on box alternating panels with trophies and architectural ornament on top. Victory presenting a scroll to a warrior, on bottom, trophies, flags and scrolls; gilt lined.

label: Physical description
value: chased, engraved and partially nielloed and gilt raised and cast silver

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Platform resting on four ball feet; incurving corners with leaf ornaments. Gallery which is set back of flange on platform is pierced in leaf design with solid panels at corners. On the platform are two square blocks each supporting a round column with lion masks and removable covers. Between the columns and attached to them is a globe; the lower half soiled and decorated with overlapping leaves; the upper half hinged to form a cover, has pierced pattern of circles and leaves and the portrait of a man.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: Embossed acanthus boughs form four panels in heart forms with the point on top; buds stand there, on the lower part of the shaf.  Cherubim appliques are in the panels.  A baluster forms the upper part of the shaft.  Ovoidal sun with an avoidal pyx.  Four masks of women are applied upon the frame of the opening, a rose to the point of the fleur-de-lys on top.  Augsburgian hallmark.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum
Head of a Man in Turban

label: Description
value: Shown from the front, the eyes of the main figure turn toward the left.

label: Physical description
value: Black and red chalk on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
St. Paul Preaching upon the Areopagus in Athens

label: Description
value: St. Paul stands on a platform listening to the surrounding robed men. A soldier stands behind him. Part of a carved architectural structure and statue of Athena are in the background.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash

label: Provenance
value: Peoli Collection; Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Scalloped circular silver frame engraced with leaves and flowers holding mirror glass. Back repousse with floral wreath, with horn-of-plenty bouquet in center.

label: Physical description
value: Repoussé and chased silver, mirrored plate glass

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for an Altar at San Petronio, Bologna

label: Description
value: Steps lead up to the altar in what is probably meant as an entirely painted niche pavillion. A curtain hangs in the rear intercolumniations. Angels crouching on the triangular pediment hold a cross. The Annunciation is shown in the lunette. Two coffered arches.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Design for a gilt table clock: a child reaches towards a seated allegorical female figure (Hope?) atop a clock face (its encasing suggesting a rock).  The broken, shipwrecked hull of a sailing vessel flanks the bottom of the clock which, in turn, rests on a base decorated with bas relief of Neptune (holding a trident) riding the sea accompanied by a Triton.  Flanking the frieze are decorations featuring anchors entwined with rope.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink, brush and yellow, green and brown washes on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Notes
value: Design for a gilt table clock: a child reaches towards a seated allegorical female figure (Hope?) atop a clock face (its encasing suggesting a rock). The broken, shipwrecked hull of a sailing vessel flanks the bottom of the clock which, in turn, rests on a base decorated with bas relief of Neptune (holding a trident) riding the sea accompanied by a Triton. Flanking the frieze are decorations featuring anchors entwined with rope.

label: Description
value: Base, supported by claw feet, its front panel decorated with four putti, two with a bow and arrow. Clock dial above at left incased in the front of a table with cloth. A lyre stands on top of table. At right, a seated woman in classical dress, her arm outstretched, holding a book.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red, brown, watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Nude woman lying from left to right. The body is slightly turned to the left and the head bent to the right leaning on her left hand. Drapery curls diagonally around the left hip to rest on the right inner thigh.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in crayon manner, black and white colors on blue paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a title page or frontispiece dedicated to the Empress Maria Theresa

label: Description
value: A queen is seated on a throne under a canopy, surrounded by carefully identified allegorical figures.

value: Pen and black ink, brush and ink wash

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a crest with a coat of arms

label: Description
value: A design for a coat of arms rests on a two-storied base. A winged putto rests on either side of the crest, each kneeling atop a scrolling ornament. They each hold an end of a festoon upon which a crowned escutcheon rests bearing three small lioness heads and an inscription.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, traces of graphite on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Scalloped oval silver frame, engraved with radiating lines, holding mirror glass. Back repousse with scrolled wreath around flowers in frames radiating from center, which is covered by a separate piece of oval repousse silver. Suspension ring on one long side.

label: Physical description
value: Repoussé and chased silver, mirrored plate glass

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Christ Appearing to the Apostles at the Sea of Gallilee (Lake Tiberias), the Miraculous Draught of Fishes

label: Description
value: Christ, at left, talks to the sinking Peter. Two boats full of people float directly behind Peter.

value: Charcoal, brush and grey wash, light brown goache, with white heightening on brown laid paper

value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

Two Boys Looking at a Book

label: Description
value: One boy is seated under a tree with a book in his lap, his arm around the other boy's shoulders. The other boy is lying on his stomach, propped up on his elbows. A dog sits expectantly to the left of the seated boy. A faint outline of a church is in the background of the hilly country landscape.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and wash on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Five classicizing figures stand around a central crowned emblem with an eagle in the center and a stylized vegetal border. The figures hold attributes including a cornicopia, laurel branch, and winged Victory.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, pen and ink, brush and bistre wash on light brown paper

value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Joseph, father of Jesus, sleeps as angels fly above him into the clouds, some supporting a large cross--premonition of the crucifixion.

value: Graphite, pen and brown ink on white laid paper

label: Description
value: Part of a fountain is shown in the foreground. Steps lead down to a basin which is on the same level with the park, whereas the palace stands on a terrace. Birds on the steps, and a man feeding one of them, probably representing sculptures.

value: Pen and ink, brush and bistre wash on laid paper

Sheet with putti and studies after the antique

value: The sheet is covered in figural studies for putti, fantastical creatures, masks, and other decorative motifs.

value: Graphite, pen and black ink on paper

value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A fortified castle lies in the center left by the shore of a river. A water mill and cottage are depicted at the river bank. A group of three men are gather by a tree in the center right. A harbor city looms in the distance in front of the setting sun.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and grey and black watercolors on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A stream flows from the left background to the right foreground. An arch bridge crosses the river. A town lies on its left bank. Ruins of a Classical tholos are depicted on a cliff in the foreground. A man and small boy are shown walking on a road to the left of the composition with their backs to the viewer.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and grey watercolors on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Male youth reclines against logs, his dog rests in front of him biting its left hind leg. A slightly sketched goddess sits above on a cloud, watching him.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, white heightening on grey/blue rough paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Female head and left shoulder in three-quarter profile turned rightward. She wears a blue/grey ribbon tied at the back of the neck.

label: Physical description
value: Red, black, and white chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Head, in profile, shown turned toward right shoulder.  Necklace, string of pearls, and earing indicated.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rectangular box on black base. Long drawer in open position decorated with center rosette, flanked by stylized leaf motif. Inkstand supported by two chimeras. A bell at center is flanked by square inkpots, the left has an engraved cover. Arms with sockets, presumably to hold pens or candles, at either end.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rectangular box on cushion feet, drawer in open position, at right. Front panel decorated with swans, scrolling leaves and masks. Top of box shows a center urn flanked by half-cupids, covered cups at either end.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rectangular black base supports a box, drawer in open position (at right). Box decorated with center mask flanked by stylized leaf motifs. On top of box, a crouching black figure, two arrows at his back, reaching towards a classical vase, a flat circular bowl at right.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Inkstand on wooden base, right drawer open position. Iconography of the sea. Dragon, pierced with a spear flank central basin. Above, inkpot is in shape of a dolphin body, terminate with a twisted mouthpiece, which served as a pen holder.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red watercolor, black wash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Oval base decorated with band of overlapping acanthus leaves, applied leaf design above, holds ink pot with open lid, the front showing a mask with protruding tongue. Pen holders, in shape of a horn, flank the pot.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red watercolor, black, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rectangular base on cushion feet supports inkstand consisting of two inkpots in shell motif, lid open on right pot, pen holders on each side of fluted basin. A covered cup with a knop in shape of a wreath stands on a block, on which putti holding a pen and writing tablet, are seating on either side.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rectangular panel, incised with a diamond pattern, drapery below, is supported by two posts consisting of claw feet, a square panel, and a female Egyptian bust at top.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red, green watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal design, two pilasters, center panel. Large pitcher at left, low bowl with flame at right. Front of pilasters decorated with two-handled pitchers. Elongated front panel shows two fantastic swans flanking a stylized pineapple surrounded by a leaf motif.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red, green, black watercolor, pen and black ink, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal design, two pilasters, center panel. A sauceboat at left, bowl on stand at right. Front of pilasters decorated with trophy and burning torch. Elongated front panel shows two putti flanking a beehive. The left putto shoots at it, the right putto holds a lighted torch to it. At left, a tree stump. At right, a plant in box.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, green, red, black watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value:
Above: front panel shows head of Medusa, flanked by sphinx heads atop pilasters, a flower head on center block and festooned legs below. 
Below: elongated panel, two female spirits kneel beside a flaming tripod. Caducei decorate pilasters. On top of left pilaster, a sauceboat. At right, a bowl on stand.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red, green, black watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value:
Above: center panel with a lion mask flanked by pilasters decorated with palmette motif. On top, lowered bowl at left; footed flaming bowl at right. 
Below: center panel shows opposing fantastic swans flanking a floral motif. Palmettes at either end. On top, lowered bowl at left; footed flaming bowl at right.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, green, red, black watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value:
Above, a lion stands in profile, front right paw on a ball. Pilasters decorated with a vertical plant design, a ball atop. Front panel decorated with oak leaf design.

Below, a railing consisting of ovals with floral centers connected by rosettes. Protruding pilasters with decorated arrows intertwined with wreaths, large ball atop left pilaster.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and yellow, red-brown, green watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
